<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Reflective Ripple Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=7493) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=701" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=732" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Rival Academies](/Sources.aspx?ID=235) pg. 80

**Requirements**
You’re unarmored.

</column>

---

You enter a stance of fluid grace as small amounts of water flow with your movements and attacks. You can make flowing wave attacks that deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=577), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661), [trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=716), [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719), and [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=732) traits.

 While in Reflective Ripple Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=2383), [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=2381), or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=2382), and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC to avoid being Disarmed and Tripped.

**Special** This feat gains your choice of either the [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579) or [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=662) trait, matching your qi spell tradition if possible.

<title level="2">Reflective Ripple Stance leads to...</title>
[Rippling Spin](/Feats.aspx?ID=7499), [Wave Spiral](/Feats.aspx?ID=7504)
name: Reflective Ripple Stance
